targeter 1.2

report

Source: R/report.R
report.Rd

This function creates an automatic report according to a predefined template in the package or a user-generated template.

Usage

report(
  object,
  template = NULL,
  template_params = NULL,
  summary_object = NULL,
  browse = FALSE,
  ntop = NULL,
  nmin = 20,
  criteria = c("IV"),
  min_criteria = NULL,
  metadata = NULL,
  force_vars = character(),
  output_format = c("html", "pdf", "word"),
  output_file = NULL,
  output_dir = tempdir(),
  ...
)

Arguments

object

an object of calss "targeter".

template

template file path. By default, it put to NULL and take the default template.

template_params

list of parameters passed to template used for report. targeter paackage default template handles a parameter called 'show_tables' (default=TRUE). Your own template files might have other parameters. value "ask" is possible if template contains parameters with suitable definition for interactive user interface, user can explicitely require render to ask for parameters value – cf. https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/params-knit.html

summary_object

an object of class "summary.targeter": pre-computed summary of object.

browse

by default TRUE : print in the browse the output.

ntop

integer - number of variables to show in the report. For more information, see the function focus By default, NULL i.e. all variables are taken.

nmin

integer - minimum number of profiles in the selected class. For more information, see the function focus.

criteria

character - By default, the value is index.max.index. For more information, see the function focus.

min_criteria

- By default NULL. If it's specified, only the observations which have criteria >= min_criteria.

metadata

data.frame - if metadata is loaded in R environment, label of the variables can be used. Default value (NULL) corresponds to no metadata available. The label will be used for the title and the x-axis of the graph.

force_vars

- character, list of variables that will be kept and then won't never be filtered.

output_format

- By default it's html co. For a pdf, output_format = "pdf_document" and for a word, output_format="word_document".

output_file

- name of the output file to be generated. If NULL (default) an, automated name will be generated.

output_dir

- output directory, default: tempdir().

...

other parameter from the function render.

Value

path to the generated report. Side effect would be to open a document, if browse is TRUE.

See also

  • targeter

  • summary.targeter

  • focus

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
t <- targeter(adult, target ="ABOVE50K", analysis_name="Analyse",
naming_conventions=FALSE)
report(t, output_format = "pdf_document")
report(ntop = 5)
} # }
